definition: to shield (a miscreant) from punishment, criticism etc/to take sb's side

sentences.english: The most watched development. of course. is the threat of trcommerciinge protectionism.
sentences.chinese: 當然，最有目共睹的進展是貿易袒護主義的威迫。

sentences.english: "I will not shield my child," the elder Li said.
sentences.chinese: “我不會袒護我的兒子的，”李剛說道。

sentences.english: Your son suffers from your excessive shielding.
sentences.chinese: 你的過分袒護，反而害了你的兒子。

sentences.english: The stain "is" cover "martial peace again after feature-length works.
sentences.chinese: 《污點》是武和平《袒護》之後又一部長篇力作。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, Saudis in general dislike what they see as America’s bias towards Israel.
sentences.chinese: 同時，沙特對美國袒護以色列也很有看法。

sentences.english: I convergence in my hands and feet, to protect, but difficult to avoid grounding.
sentences.chinese: 我收斂我的手腳，極力袒護，但還是要難避磨礪。

definition: man behind the mirror/puppet master/string puller
to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
to criticize (as a matter of principle)
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
to defend sb (a relative, friend or oneself) despite knowing that that person is in the wrong
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
to run amok (idiom); to commit outrages
variant of 誣衊|诬蔑[wu1 mie4]
to start rumours and create trouble
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
